content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Inserter Production Line at position(23.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
- Assembling machine (position 23.5, 2.5) crafting inserters
- Input burner inserter (position 21.5, 2.5) 
- Output burner inserter (position 25.5, 2.5)
- Input wooden chest (position 20.5, 2.5) containing 251 inserters
- Output wooden chest (position 26.5, 2.5)

###Iron Smelting Area
Consists of multiple furnaces:
- Furnace at (0.0, 0.0) - currently inactive
- Furnace at (2.0, 0.0) - currently inactive  
- Furnace at (4.0, 4.0) - active with 25 coal and 2 iron plates
- Furnace at (6.0, 4.0) - currently inactive

###Power Generation System
Consists of:
- Offshore pump (position -9.5, 24.5) producing water
- Boiler (position -2.5, 24.0) converting water to steam
- Steam engine (position 4.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Connected pipe network carrying water and steam
- Electric pole network connecting power to machines

###Research Lab Setup
Multiple labs set up for research:
- 2 labs with logistic science packs (2 each)
- 2 labs with automation science packs (17 and 68)
- 3 labs empty but powered
- 2 labs empty and unpowered
- 1 lab with both automation (40) and logistic (40) science packs but no power

ERROR TIPS

### Errors when crafting items requiring machine assembly
- Iron plates cannot be crafted directly - they require a furnace for smelting
- Use furnaces for smelting raw materials before attempting to craft items requiring those materials

### Errors with insufficient resources
- Ensure required materials are available in inventory before attempting crafting or insertion
- Keep track of coal levels for burner devices
- Monitor iron plate and electronic circuit availability for inserter assembly

### Errors with machine input/output
- Verify all required ingredients are available before starting assembly
- Check assembler input inventory contents match recipe requirements
- Ensure proper connection of inserters to feed materials into machines

### Power system maintenance
- Maintain coal supply in boiler to prevent power outages
- Monitor steam and water pipe connections
- Keep electrical network properly connected via power poles
